title: Wilson's Tales of the Borders and of Scotland, Volume 17
author: Alexander Leighton
snippet: He was carefully removed into Oudenard, where our hospitalswere established, and for some days his life was despaired of; but youthand a good constitution prevailed, and he again bade fair for life andhappiness.

title: Wilson's Tales of the Borders and of Scotland, Volume 17
author: Alexander Leighton
snippet: At the battle of Oudenard,where we drove the French from their trenches, your father led on his men,over the works, with too much eagerness, and was not supported for a time,as the enemy sprung a mine and made the ditch impassable, killing andwounding a great many of the advancing column.
